cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles south of Cameron, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north today, then turning north-northeast tonight, taking aim at the southwest Louisiana coast while keeping the right-hand (eastern) semicircle over the northern Gulf. Track then carries the weakening system inland through central Louisiana and toward Mississippi.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cameron, Louisiana (High Island TX – Morgan City LA coastline)

weather_observation.warning_coast: High Island TX to Morgan City LA including Calcasieu Lake, Vermilion Bay and Lake Borgne
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast Texas coast from High Island through Sabine Pass and the southwestern Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) likely Friday afternoon; brief hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out Friday evening.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible in the Sabine Lake and lower Neches River area, including Beaumont’s waterfront.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with pockets up to 10 inches possible, leading to flash and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes possible in outer rainbands; dangerous surf and rip currents on nearby Gulf beaches.
